intro: Moraea schlechteri, commonly known as the White Moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and birds. Moraea schlechteri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
